section.name: DataCite
section.definition: A published dataset referenced by a DOI and registered with DataCite. The referenced dataset will contain either the odML file itself or the data the odML is annotating. This template is a subset of the full datacite schema used by the German Neuroinformatics Node.

section.name: identifier
section.definition: The Identifier is a unique string that identifies a resource. For software, determine whether the identifier is for a specific version of a piece of software, (per the Force11 Software Citation Principles11), or for all versions.

section.name: creator #
section.definition: The main researchers involved in producing the data, or the authors of the publication, in priority order. To supply multiple creators, repeat this property.

property.name: creatorName
property.definition: The full name of the creator.

section.name: affiliation #
section.definition: The organizational or institutional affiliation of the creator.

section.name: title #
section.definition: A name or title by which a resource is known. May be the title of a dataset or the name of a piece of software.

section.name: description #
section.definition: All additional information that does not fit in any of the other categories. May be used for technical information.

property.name: descriptionType
property.definition: The type of the Description. If Description is used, descriptionType is mandatory.

section.name: rights #
section.definition: Any rights information for this resource. The property may be repeated to record complex rights characteristics.

section.name: subject #
section.definition: Subject, keyword, classification code, or key phrase describing the resource.

section.name: relatedIdentifier #
section.definition: Identifiers of related resources. These must be globally unique identifiers.

property.name: relatedIdentifierType
property.value: [ARK, arXiv, bibcode, DOI, EAN13, EISSN, Handle, IGSN, ISBN, ISSN, ISTC, LISSN, LSID, PMID, PURL, UPC, URL, URN, w3id]

property.name: relationType
property.value: [IsCitedBy, Cites, IsSupplementTo, IsSupplementedBy, IsContinuedBy, Continues, IsDescribedBy, Describes, HasMetadata, IsMetadataFor, HasVersion, IsVersionOf, IsNewVersionOf, IsPreviousVersionOf, IsPartOf, HasPart, IsReferencedBy, References, IsDocumentedBy, Documents, IsCompiledBy, Compiles, IsVariantFormOf, IsOriginalFormOf, IsIdenticalTo, IsReviewedBy, Reviews, IsDerivedFrom, IsSourceOf, IsRequiredBy, Requires, IsObsoletedBy, Obsoletes]
property.definition: Description of the relationship of the resource being registered (A) and the related resource (B).

section.name: fundingReference #
section.definition: Information about financial support (funding) for the resource being registered.

section.name: contributor #
section.definition: The institution or person responsible for collecting, managing, distributing, or otherwise contributing to the development of the resource.To supply multiple contributors, repeat this property.For software, if there is an alternate entity that "holds, archives, publishes, prints, distributes, releases, issues, or produces" the code, use the contributorType "hostingInstitution" for the code repository.

property.name: contributorType
property.value: [ContactPerson, DataCollector, DataCurator, DataManager, Distributor, Editor, HostingInstitution, Producer, ProjectLeader, ProjectManager, ProjectMember, RegistrationAgency, RegistrationAuthority, RelatedPerson, Researcher, ResearchGroup, RightsHolder, Sponsor, Supervisor, WorkPackageLeader, Other]
property.definition: The type of contributor of the resource.

property.name: contributorName
property.definition: The full name of the contributor.

property.name: publisher
property.definition: The name of the entity that holds, archives, publishes prints, distributes, releases, issues, or produces the resource. This property will be used to formulate the citation, so consider the prominence of the role. For software, use Publisher for the code repository. If there is an entity other than a code repository, that "holds, archives, publishes, prints, distributes, releases, issues, or produces" the code, use the property Contributor/contributorType/hostingInstitution for the code repository.

property.name: publicationYear
property.definition: The year when the data was or will be made publicly available. In the case of resources such as software or dynamic data where there may be multiple releases in one year, include the Date/dateType/dateInformation property and sub-properties to provide more information about the publication or release date details.

property.name: language
property.definition: The primary language of the resource. Allowed values are taken from IETF BCP 47, ISO 639-1 language codes.Examples: en, de, fr

section.name: resourceType
section.definition: A description of the resource. The format is open, but the preferred format is a single term of some detail so that a pair can be formed with the sub-property. Text formats can be free-text OR terms from the CASRAI Publications resource type list.

property.name: resourceTypeGeneral
property.value: [Audiovisual, Collection, DataPaper, Dataset, Event, Image, InteractiveResource, Model, PhysicalObject, Service, Software, Sound, Text, Workflow, Other]
property.definition: The general type of a resource.

property.name: version
property.definition: The version number of the resource. Suggested practice: track major_version.minor_version. Register a new identifier for a major version change.
